IDM_REG
[IINCHIP_REG]

Detailed Description

Indirect mode register group
These register can be accessed only in indirect address mode. In indirect address mode, You can access COMMEON_REG and SOCKET_REG indirectly using IDM_AR and IDM_DR regsiter.

See also:
__DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__
Note:
If you use the W5300 in direct address mode, you can not access these register.


Defines

#define IDM_AR   (__DEF_IINCHIP_MAP_BASE__ + 0x02)
 Indirect mode address register.
#define IDM_DR   (__DEF_IINCHIP_MAP_BASE__ + 0x04)
 Indirect mode data register.

Define Documentation

#define IDM_AR   (__DEF_IINCHIP_MAP_BASE__ + 0x02)

Indirect mode address register.

RESET value : 0x0000
It is used when indirect address mode(MR (MR_IND) = '1'). It sets address offset of COMMON_REG or SOCKET_REG that are indirectly accessible.

See also:
__DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__

Definition at line 141 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by IINCHIP_READ(), IINCHIP_WRITE(), wiz_read_buf(), and wiz_write_buf().

#define IDM_DR   (__DEF_IINCHIP_MAP_BASE__ + 0x04)

Indirect mode data register.

RESET value : 0x0000
It is used when indirect address mode(MR (MR_IND) = '1'). It accesses real data value of COMMON_REG or SOCKET_REG that are indirectly accessible.

See also:
__DEF_IINCHIP_ADDRESS_MODE__

Definition at line 154 of file w5300.h.

Referenced by IINCHIP_READ(), IINCHIP_WRITE(), wiz_read_buf(), and wiz_write_buf().
